instruction: What metric was chosen in water quality variables at Dongping Lake in China, and how well did it perform?

instruction: Can the deep learning approach driven by spectral properties be used to effectively retrieve changes in water quality variables at Dongping Lake in China?
Output: Yes, the deep learning approach driven by spectral properties can be used effectively to retrieve changes in water quality variables at Dongping Lake in China. The study applied this approach and found strong agreement between in situ and ConvLSTM-derived lake variables, indicating good performance of the developed model. The model was able to retrieve changes in water quality variables such as Chl-a, BOD, TN, CODMn, NH3-N, and TP on a monthly basis between 2013 and 2018. This suggests that the deep learning approach can be used as an effective tool for water quality monitoring and water-environment management in the complex inland lake waters of Dongping Lake.
